snippet: The N.F.L. Players Association said Rice’s indefinite suspension was not part of a “fair and impartial process.”
abstract: NFL Roundup; NFL Players Assn files appeal on behalf of Baltimore Ravens player Ray Rice, saying that his indefinite suspension for domestic violence was not part of a fair and impartial process; other football news noted.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and BILL PENNINGTON

lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. Players Association said Rice’s indefinite suspension was not part of a “fair and impartial process.”

headline.print_headline: Players Union Appeals Rice’s Longer Suspension
headline.main: N.F.L. Players Union Appeals Ray Rice’s Longer Suspension
